catalog_info.title: Human Sexuality: Research and Presentation Seminar
catalog_info.notes: This course counts towards the Human Evolution subfield requirement in HEB.
catalog_info.description: An examination of human sexuality from a scientific perspective. Students will read and present primary scientific literature that highlights current research on a variety of topics including: sexual development, gender identity, sexual orientation, cross cultural variations in mating systems, promiscuity, the evolution of monogamy, sexual attraction, sexual communication, including an exploration of the existence of human pheromones, libido and sexual dysfunction.
